resources.string: The Ministry of Haj & Umra carries out its duties in coordination with the government and local authorities to facilitate observance of pilgrimage, control and regulate services through the development of systems, use of technology, increasing the effectiveness of staff to serve pilgrims, and performance of infrastructure works with a core focus on offering religious hospitality in compliance with the international standards.
In order to develop all the facilities needed to serve pilgrims, the Ministry seeks to achieve a full spectrum of objectives, mainly:
Delivering high-quality services for the benefit of pilgrims.
Using cutting edge technology to develop professions of guidance, brokerage, representation, and internal pilgrimage.
Offering haj services with much ease and convenience th rough the use of human efforts and highly sophisticated technology.
Improving staff skills on the ground to ensure that high-quality services are delivered to the pilgrims and Umrah performers by the use of effective and excellent training programs.
Putting in place the slogan (serving pilgrims is an honor, honesty and responsibility).
Coordinating with all relevant stakeholders to make the rituals of Haj & Umra easier.
Acting in accordance with the values and teachings of tolerant Islamic faith to deliver a full range of high-class services.
Unifying efforts to stimulate nationals to do their best in the service of pilgrims either voluntarily or otherwise.

The Ministry of Haj and Umra would like to thank the Saudi Commission for Tourism and National Heritage (SCTA) regarding their cooperation in the Geographical Information for Historical and Heritage locations that been included in GYH Mutamer application.

Ministry of Haj & Umra makes no representation that any third party mobile device platform or service provider has endorsed the Services, and you should not rely on the availability of the App by means of any App catalog, storefront, or other means of downloading as an endorsement of the App, the Services or Ministry of Haj & Umra generally. In no event shall any third party mobile device platform or service provider have any obligation to you whatsoever to furnish any maintenance and support services with respect to the App.

THE LOCATION-BASED SERVICES ARE INTENDED ONLY AS FOR INDIVIDUAL USE AND SHOULD NOT BE USED OR RELIED ON AS AN EMERGENCY LOCATOR SYSTEM, USED WHILE DRIVING OR OPERATING VEHICLES, OR USED IN CONNECTION WITH ANY HAZARDOUS ENVIRONMENTS REQUIRING FAIL-SAFE PERFORMANCE, OR ANY OTHER APPLICATION IN WHICH THE FAILURE OR INACCURACY OF THAT APPLICATION OR THE APP OR SERVICES COULD LEAD DIRECTLY TO DEATH, PERSONAL INJURY, OR SEVERE PHYSICAL OR PROPERTY DAMAGE.

NEITHER Ministry of Haj & Umra, NOR ANY OF ITS ASSOCIATED MOBILE DEVICE PLATFORM AND SERVICE PROVIDERS, WARRANTS THAT THE APP WILL BE COMPATIBLE OR INTEROPERABLE WITH YOUR MOBILE DEVICE OR ANY OTHER PIECE OF HARDWARE, SOFTWARE, EQUIPMENT OR DEVICE INSTALLED ON OR USED IN CONNECTION WITH YOUR MOBILE DEVICE. FURTHERMORE, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT COMPATIBILITY AND INTEROPERABILITY PROBLEMS CAN CAUSE THE PERFORMANCE OF YOUR MOBILE DEVICE TO DIMINISH OR FAIL COMPLETELY, AND MAY RESULT IN PERMANENT DAMAGE TO YOUR MOBILE DEVICE, LOSS OF THE DATA LOCATED ON YOUR MOBILE DEVICE, AND CORRUPTION OF THE SOFTWARE AND FILES LOCATED ON YOUR MOBILE DEVICE. YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT Ministry of Haj & Umra AND ITS AFFILIATES, PARTNERS, SUPPLIERS, LICENSORS, AND ASSOCIATED MOBILE DEVICE PLATFORM AND SERVICE PROVIDERS SHALL HAVE NO LIABILITY TO YOU FOR ANY LOSSES SUFFERED RESULTING FROM OR ARISING IN CONNECTION WITH COMPATIBILITY OR INTEROPERABILITY PROBLEMS.
Terms Of Use And Conditions Of The Application

Keep in mind that once the user logs on to the website of the Ministry of Haj & Umra or uses electronic applications that are available to the public, it is considered as explicit consent and approval to abide by the terms of use and privacy policy.

1. These are the conditions applied to the use of the services provided by the Ministry of Haj & Umra on (GYH Mutamer) application, the website and all applications that are provided to the public or the Ministry intends to provide to the public.Please read these terms carefully before using (GYH Mutamer) application or the website or the services because you must abide by these conditions, or any other terms set by the service providers with the Ministry of Haj & Umra or any conditions for any of the other parties, which the user can access their websites through (GYH Mutamer) application and the website. The Ministry of Haj & Umra would like to warn that there might be special conditions for some services provided, therefore the user must comply with these conditionswhatsoever subject to the provisions stated in paragraph 15.

2. The Ministry of Haj & Umra does not grant you permission to use its services on (GYH Mutamer) application, the website and all applications that are provided to the public or the Ministry intends to provide to the public, if you do not agree on any of these conditions. If you have any questions, you can contact us through the official channels of the Ministry indicated in (GYH Mutamer) application or on the website.

3. If there is a need to make modifications to these conditions in the future, we recommend the user to review these conditions from time to time to know if it has been modified. We will always mention at the bottom of the Terms and Conditions page and the date of last update.

4. The Ministry of Haj & Umra owns the intellectual property, publication, modification, sale and authorization rights and other rights of all contents of the websites and electronic applications provided by the Ministry to the public or the Ministry intends to provide to the public. The user or other may not print, copy, download or transfer by any means whatsoever, whether electronic or other or any other system for storing electronic information of any services which are provided by the Ministry subject to the provisions stated in paragraph 10.

5. The user (user includes all beneficiaries of Haj & Umra pilgrims, visitors, citizens, residents, suppliers, employees, browsing and the like of those who download the electronic applicationseven when they are not used) shall bear all telephone charges and fees for using the services of (GYH Mutamer) application or visiting the website, as well as bear any fee paid to any entity of providing internet access service. There shall be no fees for connecting the user\'s device with the network. There might be separate fees arising in exchange for additional services required by the user, or the Ministry of Haj & Umra believes that imposing fess / financial return for some services.

6. The user must provide the Ministry of Haj & Umra with correct, valid and complete information as shown in the registration form on thecustomized and obligatory services regarding the determination of the user\'s identity such as communication with friends and family and reports and complaints services. The Ministry of Haj & Umra shall be committed not to grant access to your own information except by authorized persons from the Ministry of Haj & Umra. Knowing that the Ministry of Haj & Umra maintains the right to either suspending or terminating the possibility of user access to these parts of the services that require registration in case the user provides anyincorrect or invalid or incomplete important information (or if the Ministry of Haj & Umra has justified reason that makes the Ministry questions the matter).

7. The User bears full responsibility for maintaining the confidentiality of password and other details in the customized and obligatory services regarding the determination of the user\'s identity such as communication with friends and family, reports and complaints services. The User also bears the responsibility for all the activity of the user\'s device conducted by the user or someone else. It should be noted that if the user was unable to take reasonable measures to keep the confidentiality of the details, the user must timely notify the Ministry of Haj & Umra directly if the user became aware of any unauthorized or suspected use through your own device or others.

8. (GYH Mutamer) Application services or visiting the website are provided free of charge for all beneficiaries of Haj & Umra pilgrims, visitors, citizens, residents, browsing and the like inside the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia or abroad.

9. The user of the services provided by the Ministry of Haj & Umra must carefully and responsibly use the services. Our services may not be used for any purpose breaching the Regulations of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and international conventions ratified by the Government of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, or for any purpose related to commercial business, or in any way that would lead to interrupting, destroying or disabling our online services or making it less effective, or in any manner that could lead to damage or disable another user\'s device, or transfer, upload or post any viruses or other files or malicious programs, or transfer, upload or post any material distorting reputation or aggressive, racist, vulgar, libelous, defamatory, pornographic, obscene, threatening or may cause annoyance or unnecessary concern to another person, or as a means ofthreatening, monitoring, harassing, abusing or humiliating another person, or collecting personal data about other users, or in a way violates or breaches the rights of any other person such as copyright or right of privacy or creating a fake identity misleading others regarding the identity of the user, or transfer or provide unauthorized and undesirable advertising and promotional materials, such as junk mail, spam, chain letters, pyramid schemes or other similar material, or provide any material in any way(For example, by creating a link / URL). Such may be considered a violation of these conditions if published directly or it may contain a virus or malicious code, or may be harmful to our online services or our computer systems or the computer system of any third party orin any other way that we may consider logically affect (GYH Mutamer) application or the website or the services provided by the Ministry.

10. The Ministry of Haj & Umra provides services on (GYH Mutamer) application or the website or the electronic applications of the Ministry for personal and private use only. The information and materials may not be used for any purpose whatsoever without the written and explicit permission of the authorized person. Such written permission must becertified and approved by the Ministry of Haj & Umra and the Chamber of Commerce in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

11. User\'s use of (GYH Mutamer) applicationservices or the website or the electronic applications and materials or the idea of services affiliated to the Ministry shall not empower and grant the right of ownership or the right to assign such, or any rights related to the user or to any third party, taking into consideration the provisions stated in Paragraph 10.

12. The Ministry of Haj & Umra shall not assume any legal liability or defend the user in all courts – inside or outside Saudi Arabia – or any judicial expenses or compensation for any loss or damage or misuse or being exposed to any material, moral and intellectual damage, including viruses or direct,indirect, special or incidental damages, or resulting damage or error or breakdown or delay for the use of(GYH Mutamer) application services or the website of the application and the Ministry.

13. The Ministry of Haj & Umra has the right to file a lawsuit inside or outside Saudi Arabia and to claim compensation for any direct or indirect material, moral or intellectual damages resulted from the violation of the user or other to the conditions contained in the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.

14. The Ministry of Haj & Umra requests from the user of its servicesto maintain his privacy. The user must not express and state full name, mail address, telephone number, mobile number or e-mail address or financial information or any other information (other than the information required from the user specifically).

15. The Ministry of Haj & Umra possesses the right to suspend the user from logging, accessing or using (GYH Mutamer) application servicesor the website of the application, if it finds or suspects or has logical reasons that the user has conducted any suspicious purposes upon using any of the services or violated any of the conditions.

16. The Ministry of Haj & Umra is committed to use the latest and the best protection programs on its websites and all the applications that are available to the public. The Ministry of Haj & Umra is also committed to comply with all the regulations and instructions issued by the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia related to the field of electronic protection.

17. The Ministry of Haj & Umra possesses the right todisclose personal user data in the event that there was any judicial or security inquiry or such disclosure is required by the government to obtain any matter related to the Ministry of Haj & Umra. Thus, the user authorizes the Ministry of Haj & Umra with the right of using thepersonal user data for any purpose upon the interest of the Ministry of Haj & Umra desired from such disclosure. The user has no right to claim any compensation or financial compensation only in the event of the occurrence of an actual direct harm. The Ministry of Haj & Umra shall not assume any legal liability, in case the party to whom it has been disclosed by the Ministry of Haj & Umra used this data in an illegal or illegitimate manner.

18. All the conditions contained in the terms of use and privacy policy shall be complementary to each other. In the absence of one of these conditions for any reason, the non-absent conditions in this agreement shall be valid and by whichthe user must adhere to.

19. The courts of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the regulations thereof shall be the competent judicial authority in case of any dispute that may arise regarding these conditions or any dispute that may result from the violation of the conditions or due to these conditions, or performing any act or any matter that would distort the reputation of the Ministry of Haj & Umra with exception to what is stated in the beginning of Paragraph 19. The Ministry of Haj & Umra shall only have the right to prosecute any user or non-user of (GYH Mutamer) application services or the website of the applicationoutside the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia before any court of competent jurisdiction if the user\'s place of residence is outside Saudi Arabia or if there had been information on its presence in a particular state. Thus, the State where the user resides shall be the exclusive jurisdiction even if it is the user\'s temporary residence. The user shall not have the right to file any judicial lawsuit against the Ministry of Haj & Umra outside Saudi Arabia regarding (GYH Mutamer) application or the website of the application.

"Material is the metaphor.

"
"A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion." "The material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet " "technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic.
" "Surfaces and edges of the material provide visual cues that are grounded in reality. The " "use of familiar tactile attributes helps users quickly understand affordances. Yet the " "flexibility of the material creates new affordances that supercede those in the physical " "world, without breaking the rules of physics.
" "The fundamentals of light, surface, and movement are key to conveying how objects move, " "interact, and exist in space and in relation to each other. Realistic lighting shows " "seams, divides space, and indicates moving parts.

"
"Bold, graphic, intentional.

"
"The foundational elements of print based design typography, grids, space, scale, color, " "and use of imagery guide visual treatments. These elements do far more than please the " "eye. They create hierarchy, meaning, and focus. Deliberate color choices, edge to edge " "imagery, large scale typography, and intentional white space create a bold and graphic " "interface that immerse the user in the experience.
" "An emphasis on user actions makes core functionality immediately apparent and provides " "waypoints for the user.

"
"Motion provides meaning.

"
"Motion respects and reinforces the user as the prime mover. Primary user actions are " "inflection points that initiate motion, transforming the whole design.
" "All action takes place in a single environment. Objects are presented to the user without " "breaking the continuity of experience even as they transform and reorganize.
" "Motion is meaningful and appropriate, serving to focus attention and maintain continuity. " "Feedback is subtle yet clear. Transitions are efﬁcient yet coherent.

"
"3D world.

"
"The material environment is a 3D space, which means all objects have x, y, and z " "dimensions. The z-axis is perpendicularly aligned to the plane of the display, with the " "positive z-axis extending towards the viewer. Every sheet of material occupies a single " "position along the z-axis and has a standard 1dp thickness.
" "On the web, the z-axis is used for layering and not for perspective. The 3D world is " "emulated by manipulating the y-axis.

"
"Light and shadow.

"
"Within the material environment, virtual lights illuminate the scene. Key lights create " "directional shadows, while ambient light creates soft shadows from all angles.
" "Shadows in the material environment are cast by these two light sources. In Android " "development, shadows occur when light sources are blocked by sheets of material at " "various positions along the z-axis. On the web, shadows are depicted by manipulating the " "y-axis only. The following example shows the card with a height of 6dp.

"
"Resting elevation.

"
"All material objects, regardless of size, have a resting elevation, or default elevation " "that does not change. If an object changes elevation, it should return to its resting " "elevation as soon as possible.

"
"Component elevations.

"
"The resting elevation for a component type is consistent across apps (e.g., FAB elevation " "does not vary from 6dp in one app to 16dp in another app).
" "Components may have different resting elevations across platforms, depending on the depth " "of the environment (e.g., TV has a greater depth than mobile or desktop).

"
"Responsive elevation and dynamic elevation offsets.

"
"Some component types have responsive elevation, meaning they change elevation in response " "to user input (e.g., normal, focused, and pressed) or system events. These elevation " "changes are consistently implemented using dynamic elevation offsets.
" "Dynamic elevation offsets are the goal elevation that a component moves towards, relative " "to the component’s resting state. They ensure that elevation changes are consistent " "across actions and component types. For example, all components that lift on press have " "the same elevation change relative to their resting elevation.
" "Once the input event is completed or cancelled, the component will return to its resting " "elevation.

"
"Avoiding elevation interference.

"
"Components with responsive elevations may encounter other components as they move between " "their resting elevations and dynamic elevation offsets. Because material cannot pass " "through other material, components avoid interfering with one another any number of ways, " "whether on a per component basis or using the entire app layout.
" "On a component level, components can move or be removed before they cause interference. " "For example, a floating action button (FAB) can disappear or move off screen before a " "user picks up a card, or it can move if a snackbar appears.
" "On the layout level, design your app layout to minimize opportunities for interference. " "For example, position the FAB to one side of stream of a cards so the FAB won’t interfere " "when a user tries to pick up one of cards.

"
